message.content:
cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV. 

This paper is about ad-hoc retrieval, which is a subfield of information retrieval (IR) that focuses on retrieving relevant documents from a large collection based on a user's query. Therefore, cs.IR is the most likely sub-category. The paper proposes a neural model that uses semantic matching to assess relevance signals at different granularities, which involves natural language processing (NLP) techniques. Hence, cs.CL is also a likely sub-category. The model also involves machine learning techniques to learn the relevance patterns, which could fall under cs.LG and cs.AI. Finally, the paper uses benchmark datasets that involve text documents, which could also relate to cs.CV.
